title: Hello Porobros, posting here to pass along something I found that would help fullscreen FPS problems
body:
Hi Porobros, long time no talk.

Hope your holidays were great^^

I found something on Reddit yesterday to remove the FPS drops people on Windows 10 are having with League on fullscreen.
The link is below:
https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/7o32lm/made_an_app_to_bulk_disable_w10_fullscreen/

I know it's not an issue on League's end, but I'd lump it in the same box as the x-box DVR.
If it would be possible to get it to the right people that would be really cool.

{{item:2054}} {{item:3682}} Thanks a bunch!
-LostFr0st
{{sticker:katarina-love}}

replies.body:
I've been fine.  <3  Missed you guys.
Mostly hanging out on Player Behaviour for now.  There's a lot of stuff to be done there.
Too many floggings, not enough valuable discussion.  It seems to be changing a bit though.

I noticed today there are posts that should be there leaking into H&S too; I'll be around here more now that I've noticed that.
-----------------
Yes, I'm aware of the third party stuff being a big problem.
Plus non-tech savvy people ruining their own computers :P

It's best you guys' experts take a look and find the way to use this to help people.
The OP on the Reddit thread seems open for discussion if the tech people want to chat with him too.

Thanks again Porocles!

<3 Glad to see ya again, stay awhile!  

So, I don't think we'll be moving forward with the steps in that thread because it's too risky and broad of a fix so it may not impact some players at all.  

Chatting with the tech team, it looks like fullscreen optimization is **specific **to Windows 10 Fall Creators update and they have [FCU ](https://privacy.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10-windows-update-delivery-optimization) enabled.  We can definitely suggest players on that OS disable that as a step, with those caveats:

Right click the League Icon on your Desktop -> Properties -> Compatibility -> Disable Fullscreen Optimization

Much safer than downloading unsupported software.
